    "patch": "@@ -184,5 +184,6 @@ You can use the Microsoft Graph API to customize a few items programmatically. F\n \n ## Related content\n \n-In this article we learned how to customize the look and feel of the customer sign-in and sign-up experience. To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see the [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md) article.\n-For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the article [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md).\n+- For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- For information about how create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant, see [Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants](how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "3c2d0898fcad6af9b8c8e74886d77e4276f5f85b",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 237,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 237,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/dd05658dde87ca5be69bd3b18c64b06a4851c0b0/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/dd05658dde87ca5be69bd3b18c64b06a4851c0b0/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md?ref=dd05658dde87ca5be69bd3b18c64b06a4851c0b0",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,237 @@\n+---\n+title: Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+description: Learn about how to create branding themes and apply them to the sign-in experience for your application in Microsoft External ID for external tenants.\n+author: rolyon\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.author: rolyon\n+ms.date: 10/30/2025\n+ms.reviewer: \n+ms.service: identity-platform\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+#Customer intent: As a developer integrating with Microsoft Entra ID, I want to customize the sign-in experience for my application.\n+\n+---\n+\n+# Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [applies-to-external-only](../includes/applies-to-external-only.md)]\n+\n+> [!IMPORTANT]\n+> Branding themes for applications are currently in PREVIEW.\n+> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before it's released. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.\n+\n+You can create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant. Each application can have its own theme that you can customize with a background image or color, favicon, layout, header, and footer. This customization overrides any configurations made to the default branding. If you don't make any changes to the elements, the default elements are displayed.\n+\n+This article describes how you can create multiple branding themes for different applications in your tenant.\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+- Have at least the [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) role.\n+- Have at least the [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator) role for applications that you want to apply a theme to.\n+- A registered application in your tenant. If you haven't registered an application yet, see [Register an application](../../identity-platform/quickstart-register-app.md).\n+- Review the file size requirements for each image you want to add. Use a photo editor if needed to create correctly sized and formatted images: PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+\n+## Branding theme properties\n+\n+When you create a branding theme, here are some of the properties you can customize.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the sign-in page, with each of the default branding elements highlighted.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\":::\n+\n+| Property | Description |\n+| --- | --- |\n+| Favicon | Small icon that appears on the left side of the browser tab. |\n+| Header | Space across the top of the sign-in page, behind the header log. |\n+| Header logo | Logo that appears in the upper-left corner of the sign-in page. |\n+| Background image | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Page background color | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Banner logo | Logo that appears at the top of the sign-in box |\n+| Sign-in page title | Larger text that appears below the banner logo. |\n+| Sign-in page description | Text to describe the sign-in page. |\n+| Username hint and text | The text that appears before a user enters their information. |\n+| Sign-in display message box | Text you can add below the username field. |\n+| Footer link: Privacy & Cookies | Link you can add to the lower-right corner for privacy information. |\n+| Footer: Terms of Use | Text in the lower-right corner of the page where you can add Terms of use information. |\n+| Footer | Space across the bottom of the page for privacy and Terms of Use information. |\n+| Template | The layout of the page and sign-in boxes. |\n+\n+## How branding themes work\n+\n+Branding themes build on neutral branding and default branding.\n+\n+- **Branding theme** - Customizations of the default branding where you can have multiple themes.\n+- **Default branding (company branding)** - Customizations of the neutral branding for a tenant.\n+- **Neutral branding** - Initial branding for a tenant.\n+\n+Here are some important things to know about how branding themes work.\n+\n+- Branding themes can be applied to specific applications, while default branding applies tenant-wide.\n+- Default branding is used as fallback for any properties not defined in the branding theme.\n+- Neutral branding is used for any properties not defined in default branding.\n+\n+## Limits and constraints\n+\n+Here are some of the limits and constraints for branding themes.\n+\n+- You can create up to 5 branding themes per tenant.\n+- The live preview capability previews style and layout changes and only shows the Sign in page. Live preview doesn't include any custom text overrides.\n+- You can't use the name **Default theme** for your branding theme name. This name is reserved.\n+- Custom text changes are currently limited to sign-in page only.\n+- If you don't update the banner logo property, the Microsoft logo is displayed instead of the tenant name (neutral branding).\n+\n+## Create a new theme\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/) as [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) and [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Custom branding**.\n+\n+1. On the **Company branding** page, select **Branding themes** and then select the **Themes** tab.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Company Branding page and the Themes tab.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Create new theme**.\n+   \n+1. On the **Basics** tab, enter a **Name** for your theme.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Basics tab to apply themes to applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. To select the applications that will use this theme, under **Apply theme to**, select **Add applications**. (Or you can [add applications later](#apply-a-theme-to-applications).)\n+\n+1. On the **Layout** tab, select the placement of web page elements on the sign-in page.\n+\n+   - **Layout template** – Choose whether the sign-in pane is centre-aligned on the page or right-aligned.\n+   - **Header** – To show an image in a page header, select the checkbox and browse for the image you want to display. Requirements: Transparent PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+   - **Footer** – To show a page footer that includes links to your published privacy and cookies and/or terms of use statements, select the appropriate checkbox, enter the link text, and add the URL for your content.\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Layout tab to specify the sign-in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your changes to the layout.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Preview button to preview a layout.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Styling** tab, modify any of the background elements.\n+\n+   - **Background color** – The color that replaces the background image whenever the image can't be loaded, for example due to connection latency.\n+   - **Background image** – The large image that displays on the sign-in page. If you upload an image, it scales and crops to fill the browser window.\n+   - **Favicon** – The icon that displays in the web browser tab.\n+   - **Banner logo** – Displays on the sign-in page and in the user's access panel.\n+   - **Square logo (light theme)** – Represents user accounts in your tenant.\n+   - **Square logo (dark theme)** – If the light theme square logo displays poorly on dark backgrounds, you can upload a logo to be used in its place when dark backgrounds are used.\n+   - **Custom CSS** – Upload your own CSS file to replace default Microsoft styling with your own styling for: color, font, text size, position of elements, and displays for different devices and screen sizes. For more information, see [CSS template reference guide](../../fundamentals/reference-company-branding-css-template.md).\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Styling tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your styling changes.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the customized Sign in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Custom text** tab, for the **Sign-in** page, select the **Default** link.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Custom text tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Customize the text for the selected page and then select **Add**.\n+\n+    Custom text set for a theme might impact localized UX as they will not be localized. To ensure full localization of all text, set custom text for each theme language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit custom text page for the Sign-in page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, review your settings.\n+\n+1. Select **Create** to create the theme.\n+\n+## Apply a theme to applications\n+\n+In this section, you apply a theme to applications in your tenant.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Under **Basics**, select the pencil edit icon.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Overview tab of the edit theme page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\":::\n+\n+1. Under **Apply theme to**, select **Edit** to edit the list of applications.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit Basics page to edit the list of applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\":::\n+\n+1. Search for or browse to your application. Select the check box, and then choose **Select**.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add applications page to select applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\":::\n+\n+## Edit a theme\n+\n+In this section, you edit a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Select the pencil edit icon of the parts you want to edit.\n+\n+## Add a language to a theme\n+\n+In this section, you add a language to a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. On the **Languages** tab, select **Add a language** to customize the language of the theme.\n+\n+    The steps for customizing the language are similar to customizing branding theme.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Languages tab to add a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Basics** tab, select a language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add a language page and Basics tab to select a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\":::\n+\n+    The following languages are supported:\n+    \n+    - Arabic (Saudi Arabia)\n+    - Basque (Basque)\n+    - Bulgarian (Bulgaria)\n+    - Catalan (Catalan)\n+    - Chinese (China)\n+    - Chinese (Hong Kong SAR)\n+    - Croatian (Croatia)\n+    - Czech (Czechia)\n+    - Danish (Denmark)\n+    - Dutch (Netherlands)\n+    - English (United States)\n+    - Estonian (Estonia)\n+    - Finnish (Finland)\n+    - French (France)\n+    - Galician (Galician)\n+    - German (Germany)\n+    - Greek (Greece)\n+    - Hebrew (Israel)\n+    - Hungarian (Hungary)\n+    - Italian (Italy)\n+    - Japanese (Japan)\n+    - Kazakh (Kazakhstan)\n+    - Korean (Korea)\n+    - Latvian (Latvia)\n+    - Lithuanian (Lithuania)\n+    - Norwegian Bokmål (Norway)\n+    - Polish (Poland)\n+    - Portuguese (Brazil)\n+    - Portuguese (Portugal)\n+    - Romanian (Romania)\n+    - Russian (Russia)\n+    - Serbian (Latin, Serbia)\n+    - Slovak (Slovakia)\n+    - Slovenian (Slovenia)\n+    - Spanish (Spain)\n+    - Swedish (Sweden)\n+    - Thai (Thailand)\n+    - Turkish (Türkiye)\n+    - Ukrainian (Ukraine)\n+\n+1. Customize the elements on the **Layout**, **Styling**, and **Custom text** tabs.\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, select **Add** to add the language.\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- [Configure your company branding](../../fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md)"
  },

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: The changes introduce a new document, `how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md`, which details how to create and apply distinct branding themes to individual applications within an external Microsoft Entra tenant. This allows for unique sign-in experiences per application, overriding the default tenant-wide branding. The existing `how-to-customize-branding-customers.md` document has been updated to link to this new resource, and the table of contents (`toc.yml`) has been modified to include the new document under the "Customize branding" section for external identities.

changes.author: v-ccolin
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9734 from rolyon/rolyon-external-id-branding-theme-application

[Entra External ID] Customize your app with branding themes

F\n \n ## Related content\n \n-In this article we learned how to customize the look and feel of the customer sign-in and sign-up experience. To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see the [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md) article.\n-For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the article [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md).\n+- For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- For information about how create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant, see [Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants](how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "3c2d0898fcad6af9b8c8e74886d77e4276f5f85b",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 237,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 237,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/9671a3c15f3f3345bba943778159ce9e756af06a/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/9671a3c15f3f3345bba943778159ce9e756af06a/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md?ref=9671a3c15f3f3345bba943778159ce9e756af06a",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,237 @@\n+---\n+title: Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+description: Learn about how to create branding themes and apply them to the sign-in experience for your application in Microsoft External ID for external tenants.\n+author: rolyon\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.author: rolyon\n+ms.date: 10/30/2025\n+ms.reviewer: \n+ms.service: identity-platform\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+#Customer intent: As a developer integrating with Microsoft Entra ID, I want to customize the sign-in experience for my application.\n+\n+---\n+\n+# Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [applies-to-external-only](../includes/applies-to-external-only.md)]\n+\n+> [!IMPORTANT]\n+> Branding themes for applications are currently in PREVIEW.\n+> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before it's released. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.\n+\n+You can create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant. Each application can have its own theme that you can customize with a background image or color, favicon, layout, header, and footer. This customization overrides any configurations made to the default branding. If you don't make any changes to the elements, the default elements are displayed.\n+\n+This article describes how you can create multiple branding themes for different applications in your tenant.\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+- Have at least the [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) role.\n+- Have at least the [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator) role for applications that you want to apply a theme to.\n+- A registered application in your tenant. If you haven't registered an application yet, see [Register an application](../../identity-platform/quickstart-register-app.md).\n+- Review the file size requirements for each image you want to add. Use a photo editor if needed to create correctly sized and formatted images: PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+\n+## Branding theme properties\n+\n+When you create a branding theme, here are some of the properties you can customize.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the sign-in page, with each of the default branding elements highlighted.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\":::\n+\n+| Property | Description |\n+| --- | --- |\n+| Favicon | Small icon that appears on the left side of the browser tab. |\n+| Header | Space across the top of the sign-in page, behind the header log. |\n+| Header logo | Logo that appears in the upper-left corner of the sign-in page. |\n+| Background image | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Page background color | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Banner logo | Logo that appears at the top of the sign-in box |\n+| Sign-in page title | Larger text that appears below the banner logo. |\n+| Sign-in page description | Text to describe the sign-in page. |\n+| Username hint and text | The text that appears before a user enters their information. |\n+| Sign-in display message box | Text you can add below the username field. |\n+| Footer link: Privacy & Cookies | Link you can add to the lower-right corner for privacy information. |\n+| Footer: Terms of Use | Text in the lower-right corner of the page where you can add Terms of use information. |\n+| Footer | Space across the bottom of the page for privacy and Terms of Use information. |\n+| Template | The layout of the page and sign-in boxes. |\n+\n+## How branding themes work\n+\n+Branding themes build on neutral branding and default branding.\n+\n+- **Branding theme** - Customizations of the default branding where you can have multiple themes.\n+- **Default branding (company branding)** - Customizations of the neutral branding for a tenant.\n+- **Neutral branding** - Initial branding for a tenant.\n+\n+Here are some important things to know about how branding themes work.\n+\n+- Branding themes can be applied to specific applications, while default branding applies tenant-wide.\n+- Default branding is used as fallback for any properties not defined in the branding theme.\n+- Neutral branding is used for any properties not defined in default branding.\n+\n+## Limits and constraints\n+\n+Here are some of the limits and constraints for branding themes.\n+\n+- You can create up to 5 branding themes per tenant.\n+- The live preview capability previews style and layout changes and only shows the Sign in page. Live preview doesn't include any custom text overrides.\n+- You can't use the name **Default theme** for your branding theme name. This name is reserved.\n+- Custom text changes are currently limited to sign-in page only.\n+- If you don't update the banner logo property, the Microsoft logo is displayed instead of the tenant name (neutral branding).\n+\n+## Create a new theme\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/) as [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) and [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Custom branding**.\n+\n+1. On the **Company branding** page, select **Branding themes** and then select the **Themes** tab.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Company Branding page and the Themes tab.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Create new theme**.\n+   \n+1. On the **Basics** tab, enter a **Name** for your theme.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Basics tab to apply themes to applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. To select the applications that will use this theme, under **Apply theme to**, select **Add applications**. (Or you can [add applications later](#apply-a-theme-to-applications).)\n+\n+1. On the **Layout** tab, select the placement of web page elements on the sign-in page.\n+\n+   - **Layout template** – Choose whether the sign-in pane is centre-aligned on the page or right-aligned.\n+   - **Header** – To show an image in a page header, select the checkbox and browse for the image you want to display. Requirements: Transparent PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+   - **Footer** – To show a page footer that includes links to your published privacy and cookies and/or terms of use statements, select the appropriate checkbox, enter the link text, and add the URL for your content.\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Layout tab to specify the sign-in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your changes to the layout.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Preview button to preview a layout.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Styling** tab, modify any of the background elements.\n+\n+   - **Background color** – The color that replaces the background image whenever the image can't be loaded, for example due to connection latency.\n+   - **Background image** – The large image that displays on the sign-in page. If you upload an image, it scales and crops to fill the browser window.\n+   - **Favicon** – The icon that displays in the web browser tab.\n+   - **Banner logo** – Displays on the sign-in page and in the user's access panel.\n+   - **Square logo (light theme)** – Represents user accounts in your tenant.\n+   - **Square logo (dark theme)** – If the light theme square logo displays poorly on dark backgrounds, you can upload a logo to be used in its place when dark backgrounds are used.\n+   - **Custom CSS** – Upload your own CSS file to replace default Microsoft styling with your own styling for: color, font, text size, position of elements, and displays for different devices and screen sizes. For more information, see [CSS template reference guide](../../fundamentals/reference-company-branding-css-template.md).\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Styling tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your styling changes.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the customized Sign in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Custom text** tab, for the **Sign-in** page, select the **Default** link.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Custom text tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Customize the text for the selected page and then select **Add**.\n+\n+    Custom text set for a theme might impact localized UX as they will not be localized. To ensure full localization of all text, set custom text for each theme language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit custom text page for the Sign-in page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, review your settings.\n+\n+1. Select **Create** to create the theme.\n+\n+## Apply a theme to applications\n+\n+In this section, you apply a theme to applications in your tenant.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Under **Basics**, select the pencil edit icon.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Overview tab of the edit theme page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\":::\n+\n+1. Under **Apply theme to**, select **Edit** to edit the list of applications.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit Basics page to edit the list of applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\":::\n+\n+1. Search for or browse to your application. Select the check box, and then choose **Select**.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add applications page to select applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\":::\n+\n+## Edit a theme\n+\n+In this section, you edit a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Select the pencil edit icon of the parts you want to edit.\n+\n+## Add a language to a theme\n+\n+In this section, you add a language to a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. On the **Languages** tab, select **Add a language** to customize the language of the theme.\n+\n+    The steps for customizing the language are similar to customizing branding theme.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Languages tab to add a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Basics** tab, select a language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add a language page and Basics tab to select a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\":::\n+\n+    The following languages are supported:\n+    \n+    - Arabic (Saudi Arabia)\n+    - Basque (Basque)\n+    - Bulgarian (Bulgaria)\n+    - Catalan (Catalan)\n+    - Chinese (China)\n+    - Chinese (Hong Kong SAR)\n+    - Croatian (Croatia)\n+    - Czech (Czechia)\n+    - Danish (Denmark)\n+    - Dutch (Netherlands)\n+    - English (United States)\n+    - Estonian (Estonia)\n+    - Finnish (Finland)\n+    - French (France)\n+    - Galician (Galician)\n+    - German (Germany)\n+    - Greek (Greece)\n+    - Hebrew (Israel)\n+    - Hungarian (Hungary)\n+    - Italian (Italy)\n+    - Japanese (Japan)\n+    - Kazakh (Kazakhstan)\n+    - Korean (Korea)\n+    - Latvian (Latvia)\n+    - Lithuanian (Lithuania)\n+    - Norwegian Bokmål (Norway)\n+    - Polish (Poland)\n+    - Portuguese (Brazil)\n+    - Portuguese (Portugal)\n+    - Romanian (Romania)\n+    - Russian (Russia)\n+    - Serbian (Latin, Serbia)\n+    - Slovak (Slovakia)\n+    - Slovenian (Slovenia)\n+    - Spanish (Spain)\n+    - Swedish (Sweden)\n+    - Thai (Thailand)\n+    - Turkish (Türkiye)\n+    - Ukrainian (Ukraine)\n+\n+1. Customize the elements on the **Layout**, **Styling**, and **Custom text** tabs.\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, select **Add** to add the language.\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- [Configure your company branding](../../fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md)"

ai_summary.Response:
A new document, `how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md`, has been added, detailing how to create and apply custom branding themes to individual applications within Microsoft External ID for external tenants. This new article introduces the concept of branding themes as a way to provide unique sign-in experiences for different applications, complementing the existing tenant-wide default branding.

The `how-to-customize-branding-customers.md` file has been updated to include a link to this new article in its "Related content" section. Additionally, the `toc.yml` file for the `external-id/customers` directory has been modified to include the new "Branding themes" section and link to the `how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md` article. Several image files related to the new branding themes documentation have also been added.

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-enable-multi-geo.md?ref=03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad",
    "patch": "@@ -49,21 +49,6 @@ To enable the multi-Geo capability for Microsoft Entra Private Access, complete\n > - Multi-Geo doesn't support the Domain Name System (DNS) experience.\n > - Mulit-Geo doesn't support Japan region selection through Microsoft Entra admin center.   \n \n-## Enable multi-Geo capability for Japan region\n-The UI experience through the Microsoft Entra admin center doesn't support the Japan region yet. To select Japan as **country/region** for the connector group, use Microsoft Graph APIs:\n-- Open Microsoft [Graph Explorer](https://developer.microsoft.com/graph/graph-explorer) and login with the tenant account.\n-- Create a [Connector Group](/graph/api/connectorgroup-post?view=graph-rest-beta&tabs=http&preserve-view=true) using Graph API. Use `region` property to assign the region to Japan. For example, run the `POST` request with region set to `Japan` to create a connector group assigned to Japan.\n-\n-### Example HTTP Request\n-```http\n-POST https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/onPremisesPublishingProfiles/applicationProxy/connectorGroups\n-Content-type: application/json\n-\n-{\n-  \"name\": \"<Connector Group Name>\",\n-  \"region\": \"Japan\"\n-}\n-```\n ## Related content\n \n * [How to configure private network connectors for Microsoft Entra Private Access and Microsoft Entra application proxy](how-to-configure-connectors.md)"
  },

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-transport-layer-security-settings.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-transport-layer-security-settings.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-transport-layer-security-settings.md?ref=03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,100 @@\n+---\n+title: Configure Transport Layer Security Inspection Settings (preview)\n+description: Learn how to configure a Transport Layer Security inspection certificate authority\n+author: HULKsmashGithub\n+ms.author: jayrusso\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.service: global-secure-access\n+ms.topic: how-to \n+ms.reviewer: teresayao\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+\n+\n+#customer intent: As a Global Secure Access administrator, I want to configure a context-aware Transport Layer Security inspection policy and assign the policy to users in my organization.   \n+---\n+\n+# Configure Transport Layer Security inspection settings (preview)\n+Transport Layer Security (TLS) inspection in Microsoft Entra Internet Access uses a two-tier Intermediate certificate model to issue dynamically generated leaf certificates for decrypting traffic. This article explains how to configure the Certificate Authority (CA) that serves as the Global Secure Access intermediate CA, including signing and uploading the certificate.\n+\n+> [!IMPORTANT]\n+> The Transport Layer Security inspection feature is currently in PREVIEW.   \n+> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before release. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.   \n+> While in preview, don't use TLS inspection in production environments.    \n+ \n+\n+\n+## Prerequisites   \n+To complete the steps in this process, you must have the following prerequisites in place:      \n+- A Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) service to sign the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) and generate an intermediate certificate for TLS inspection. For testing scenarios, you can also use a self-signed root certificate created with OpenSSL.   \n+- A trial license for Microsoft Entra Internet Access.  \n+- [Global Secure Access prerequisites](how-to-configure-web-content-filtering.md) \n+\n+### Global Secure Access admin: create a CSR and upload the signed certificate for TLS termination\n+To create a CSR and upload the signed certificate for TLS termination:\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/) as a [Global Secure Access Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#global-secure-access-administrator).\n+1. Browse to **Global Secure Access** > **Secure** > **TLS inspection policies**.\n+1. Switch to the **TLS inspection settings** tab.\n+1. Select **+ Create certificate**. This step starts with generating a Certificate Sign Request (CSR). \n+1. In the **Create certificate** pane, fill in the following fields:\n+   - **Certificate name**: This name appears in the certificate hierarchy when viewed in a browser. It must be unique, contain no spaces, and be no more than 12 characters long. You can't reuse previous names.\n+   - **Common name** (CN): Common name, for example, Contoso TLS ICA, that identifies the intermediate certificate.\n+   - **Organizational Unit** (OU): Organization name, for example, Contoso IT.\n+1. Select **Create CSR**. This step creates a .csr file and saves it to your default download folder.\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security-settings/create-certificate.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create certificate pane with fields filled and the Create CSR button highlighted.\":::   \n+\n+1. Sign the CSR using your PKI service. Make sure **Server Auth** is in Extended Key Usage and `certificate authority (CA)=true`, `keyCertSign,cRLSign`, and `basicConstraints=critical,CA:TRUE` in Basic Extension. Save the signed certificate in .pem format. If you're testing with a self-signed certificate, follow the instructions to [use OpenSSL to sign the CSR](#test-with-a-self-signed-root-certificate-authority-using-openssl). \n+   \n+1. Select **+ Upload certificate**.\n+1. In the Upload certificate form, upload the certificate.pem and chain.pem files.\n+1. Select **Upload signed certificate**.\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security-settings/upload-certificate.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of Upload certificate form with example certificate and chain certificate files in the upload fields.\"::: \n+\n+1. After the certificate uploads, the status changes to **Active**.  We support **one** Active certificate currently.\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security-settings/status-active.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the TLS inspection settings tab with the certificate status set to Active.\":::   \n+\n+\n+### Test with a self-signed root certificate authority using OpenSSL\n+For **testing purposes only**, use a self-signed root certificate authority (CA) that you create with OpenSSL to sign the CSR. \n+1. If you don't already have one, first create an *openssl.cnf* file with this configuration:\n+```ini\n+[ rootCA_ext ]\n+subjectKeyIdentifier = hash\n+authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid:always,issuer\n+basicConstraints = critical, CA:true\n+keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature, cRLSign, keyCertSign\n+\n+[ interCA_ext ]\n+subjectKeyIdentifier = hash\n+authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid:always,issuer\n+basicConstraints = critical, CA:true, pathlen:1\n+keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature, cRLSign, keyCertSign\n+\n+[ signedCA_ext ]\n+basicConstraints = critical, CA:true\n+keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature, cRLSign, keyCertSign\n+extendedKeyUsage = serverAuth\n+\n+[ server_ext ]\n+subjectKeyIdentifier = hash\n+authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid:always,issuer\n+basicConstraints = critical, CA:false\n+keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature\n+extendedKeyUsage = serverAuth\n+```\n+\n+2. Create a new root certificate authority and private key using the following *openssl.cnf* config file:   \n+```openssl req -x509 -new -nodes -newkey rsa:4096 -keyout rootCAchain.key -sha256 -days 370 -out rootCAchain.pem -subj \"/C=US/ST=US/O=Self Signed/CN=Self Signed Root CA\" -config openssl.cnf -extensions rootCA_ext```\n+1. Sign the CSR using the following command:\n+ ```openssl x509 -req -in <CSR file> -CA rootCAchain.pem -CAkey rootCAchain.key -CAcreateserial -out signedcertificate.pem -days 370 -sha256 -extfile openssl.cnf -extensions signedCA_ext```\n+1. Upload the signed certificates (```signedcertificate.pem```and ```rootCAchain.pem```) according to the steps in [Create a CSR and upload the signed certificate for TLS termination](#global-secure-access-admin-create-a-csr-and-upload-the-signed-certificate-for-tls-termination).\n+\n+### PowerShell examples to configure certificate authority for TLS inspection\n+Examples of configuring TLS certificate using ADCS and OpenSSL can be found in below links: \n+* [Create a TLS certificates using ADCS](scripts/powershell-active-directory-certificate-service.md)\n+* [Create a TLS certificate using OpenSSL](scripts/powershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md) \n+\n+## Related content\n+* [What is Transport Layer Security inspection?](concept-transport-layer-security.md)\n+* [How to configure Transport Layer Security inspection policy](how-to-transport-layer-security.md)\n+* [Frequently asked questions for Transport Layer Security inspection](faq-transport-layer-security.yml)\n+"
  },

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-transport-layer-security.md?ref=03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad",
    "patch": "@@ -1,19 +1,19 @@\n ---\n-title: Configure Transport Layer Security Inspection (Preview)\n+title: Configure Transport Layer Security Inspection Policies (preview)\n description: Learn how to configure a Transport Layer Security inspection policy and assign it to users in your organization.\n author: HULKsmashGithub\n ms.author: jayrusso\n manager: dougeby\n ms.service: global-secure-access\n ms.topic: how-to \n ms.reviewer: teresayao\n-ms.date: 09/10/2025\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n \n \n #customer intent: As a Global Secure Access administrator, I want to configure a context-aware Transport Layer Security inspection policy and assign the policy to users in my organization.   \n ---\n \n-# Configure Transport Layer Security inspection (Preview)\n+# Configure Transport Layer Security inspection policies (preview)\n Transport Layer Security (TLS) inspection in Microsoft Entra Internet Access lets you decrypt and inspect encrypted traffic at service edge locations. This feature lets Global Secure Access apply advanced security controls like threat detection, content filtering, and granular access policies. These access policies help protect against threats that might be hidden in encrypted communications.\n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n@@ -25,54 +25,29 @@ This article explains how to create a context-aware Transport Layer Security ins\n \n ## Prerequisites   \n To complete the steps in this process, you must have the following prerequisites in place:      \n-- A Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) service to sign the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) and generate an intermediate certificate for TLS inspection. For testing scenarios, you can also use a self-signed root certificate created with OpenSSL.   \n+- Completed TLS inspection settings with an active, enabled certificate authority.   \n - Test devices or virtual machines running Windows that are either Microsoft Entra joined or hybrid joined to your organization's Microsoft Entra ID.  \n - A trial license for Microsoft Entra Internet Access.  \n - [Global Secure Access prerequisites](how-to-configure-web-content-filtering.md) \n \n ## Create a context-aware TLS inspection policy\n To create a context-aware Transport Layer Security inspection policy and assign it to users in your organization, complete the following steps:\n-1. [Create a CSR and upload the signed certificate for TLS termination](#step-1-global-secure-access-admin-create-a-csr-and-upload-the-signed-certificate-for-tls-termination)\n-1. [Create a TLS inspection policy](#step-2-global-secure-access-admin-create-a-tls-inspection-policy)\n-1. [Link the TLS inspection policy to a security profile](#step-3-global-secure-access-admin-link-the-tls-inspection-policy-to-a-security-profile)\n-1. [Test the configuration](#step-4-test-the-configuration)\n-\n-### Step 1: Global Secure Access admin: create a CSR and upload the signed certificate for TLS termination\n-To create a CSR and upload the signed certificate for TLS termination:\n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/) as a [Global Secure Access Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#global-secure-access-administrator).\n-1. Browse to **Global Secure Access** > **Secure** > **TLS inspection policies**.\n-1. Switch to the **TLS inspection settings** tab.\n-1. Select **+ Create certificate**. This step starts with generating a Certificate Sign Request (CSR). \n-1. In the **Create certificate** pane, fill in the following fields:\n-   - **Certificate name**: This name appears in the certificate hierarchy when viewed in a browser. It must be unique, contain no spaces, and be no more than 12 characters long. You can't reuse previous names.\n-   - **Common name** (CN): Common name, for example, Contoso TLS ICA, that identifies the intermediate certificate.\n-   - **Organizational Unit** (OU): Organization name, for example, Contoso IT.\n-1. Select **Create CSR**. This step creates a .csr file and saves it to your default download folder.\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security/create-certificate.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create certificate pane with fields filled and the Create CSR button highlighted.\":::   \n-\n-1. Sign the CSR using your PKI service. Make sure Server Auth is in Extended Key Usage and `certificate authority (CA)=true`, `keyCertSign,cRLSign`, and `basicConstraints=critical,CA:TRUE` in Basic Extension. Save the signed certificate in .pem format. If you're testing with a self-signed certificate, follow the instructions to [use OpenSSL to sign the CSR](#test-with-a-self-signed-root-certificate-authority-using-openssl). \n-   \n-1. Select **+Upload certificate**.\n-1. In the Upload certificate form, upload the certificate.pem and chain.pem files.\n-1. Select **Upload signed certificate**.\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security/upload-certificate.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of Upload certificate form with example certificate and chain certificate files in the upload fields.\"::: \n-\n-1. After the certificate uploads, the status changes to **Active**.   \n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security/status-active.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the TLS inspection settings tab with the certificate status set to Active.\":::   \n-\n-For a test configuration, see [Test with a self-signed root certificate authority using OpenSSL](#test-with-a-self-signed-root-certificate-authority-using-openssl).  \n-\n-### Step 2: Global Secure Access admin: create a TLS inspection policy\n+### Step 1: Global Secure Access admin: create a TLS inspection policy\n To create a TLS inspection policy:\n-1. In the Microsoft Entra admin center, go to **Secure** > **TLS inspection policies**.\n-1. Create a new policy with **Action** set to **Inspect**.   \n-1. Select **Save**. This configuration enables TLS termination for all traffic categories except Education, Finance, Government, and Health and medicine.\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security/inspection-policy.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a TLS inspection policy screen open to the Review tab.\":::   \n+1. In the Microsoft Entra admin center, go to **Secure** > **TLS inspection policies** > **Create policy**.\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security/create-tls-inspection-policy.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a TLS inspection policy screen open to the Basics tab.\":::\n+The **Default action** specifies what to do if no rules match. The default setting is **Inspect**.\n+1.  Select **Next** > **Add rule**. On the **Rules** page, you can define a custom rule by specifying an **FQDN** or selecting a **Web category**.\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security/add-rule.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a TLS inspection policy screen open to the Rules tab.\":::\n \n-### Step 3: Global Secure Access admin: link the TLS inspection policy to a security profile\n+1. To complete the policy configuration, go to **Save** > **Next** > **Submit**. Note a system rule has been auto created to exclude destinations that do not work with TLS inspection. An editable recommended bypass rule is automatically created to exclude Education, Finance, Government, and Health & Medicine categories for TLS policies migrating from the preview. \n+1. To review rules, including the auto-created rules, select a policy and then go to **Edit** > **Rules**.\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-transport-layer-security/edit-policy-rules.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit a TLS inspection policy screen open to the Rules tab.\":::\n+\n+### Step 2: Global Secure Access admin: link the TLS inspection policy to a security profile\n Link the TLS inspection policy to a security profile. \n \n-Before you enable TLS inspection on user traffic, make sure your organization has established and communicated an appropriate Terms of Use (ToU) for end users. This step helps maintain transparency and supports compliance with privacy and consent requirements.\n+Before you enable TLS inspection on user traffic, make sure your organization has established and communicated TLS policy to end users. This step helps maintain transparency and supports compliance with privacy and consent requirements.\n \n You can link the TLS policy to a security profile in two ways:\n #### Option 1: Link the TLS policy to the baseline profile for all users   \n@@ -123,43 +98,8 @@ To disable TLS inspection:\n     1. Select **Actions**.\n     1. Select **Delete**.      \n \n-## Test with a self-signed root certificate authority using OpenSSL\n-For **testing purposes only**, use a self-signed root certificate authority (CA) that you create with OpenSSL to sign the CSR. To test with OpenSSL:\n-1. If you don't already have one, create an *openssl.cnf* file with this configuration:\n-```ini\n-[ rootCA_ext ]\n-subjectKeyIdentifier = hash\n-authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid:always,issuer\n-basicConstraints = critical, CA:true\n-keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature, cRLSign, keyCertSign\n-\n-[ interCA_ext ]\n-subjectKeyIdentifier = hash\n-authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid:always,issuer\n-basicConstraints = critical, CA:true, pathlen:1\n-keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature, cRLSign, keyCertSign\n-\n-[ signedCA_ext ]\n-basicConstraints = critical, CA:true\n-keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature, cRLSign, keyCertSign\n-extendedKeyUsage = serverAuth\n-\n-[ server_ext ]\n-subjectKeyIdentifier = hash\n-authorityKeyIdentifier = keyid:always,issuer\n-basicConstraints = critical, CA:false\n-keyUsage = critical, digitalSignature\n-extendedKeyUsage = serverAuth\n-```\n-\n-2. Create a new root certificate authority and private key using the following *openssl.cnf* config file:   \n-```openssl req -x509 -new -nodes -newkey rsa:4096 -keyout rootCAchain.key -sha256 -days 370 -out rootCAchain.pem -subj \"/C=US/ST=US/O=Self Signed/CN=Self Signed Root CA\" -config openssl.cnf -extensions rootCA_ext```\n-1. Sign the CSR using the following command:\n- ```openssl x509 -req -in <CSR file> -CA rootCAchain.pem -CAkey rootCAchain.key -CAcreateserial -out signedcertificate.pem -days 370 -sha256 -extfile openssl.cnf -extensions signedCA_ext```\n-1. Upload the signed certificates (```signedcertificate.pem```and ```rootCAchain.pem```) according to the steps in [Create a CSR and upload the signed certificate for TLS termination](#step-1-global-secure-access-admin-create-a-csr-and-upload-the-signed-certificate-for-tls-termination).\n-\n-Examples of configuring TLS certificate using powershell are listed in the below related content section.\n ## Related content\n+* [Configure TLS inspection settings](how-to-transport-layer-security-settings.md) \n * [Create a TLS certificates using ADCS](scripts/powershell-active-directory-certificate-service.md)\n * [Create a TLS certificate using OpenSSL](scripts/powershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md) \n * [What is Transport Layer Security inspection?](concept-transport-layer-security.md)"

For a list of templates, and their event user attributes, see: [Lifecycle Workflows templates and categories](lifecycle-workflow-templates.md).       |\n+|Event user attribute     | The attribute defining the change that triggers the workflow.     "sha": "0fa8ab934247d2f730e532c80637ed8ae56073c7",
    "filename": "docs/id-governance/media/workflow-custom-triggers/custom-attribute-timing.png",
    "status": "added",

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmedia%2Fworkflow-custom-triggers%2Fcustom-attribute-timing.png",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmedia%2Fworkflow-custom-triggers%2Fcustom-attribute-timing.png?ref=03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad"
  },
  {
    "sha": "e1ba49696ef70962b89ef4c20e7420c67761942e",
    "filename": "docs/id-governance/workflow-custom-triggers.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 100,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 100,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fworkflow-custom-triggers.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fworkflow-custom-triggers.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fworkflow-custom-triggers.md?ref=03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,100 @@\n+---\n+title: Use custom attribute triggers in lifecycle workflows (Preview)\n+description: This article discusses how to use Custom Attribute Triggers as an attribute change trigger within a workflow in Lifecycle Workflows.\n+author: owinfreyATL\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+ms.service: entra-id-governance\n+ms.subservice: lifecycle-workflows\n+ms.topic: how-to #Required; leave this attribute/value as-is\n+ms.date: 10/29/2025\n+\n+#CustomerIntent: As a Lifecycle Workflows Administrator, I want to use Custom Attribute triggers as an attribute change trigger so that I can trigger workflows based on other custom attributes.\n+---\n+\n+\n+\n+# Use Custom attribute triggers in lifecycle workflows (Preview)\n+\n+Lifecycle Workflows allows you to trigger workflows to run automatically for users that meet the execution conditions of the workflow. There are many default attributes that you can use to trigger workflows, but sometimes you might require triggering a workflow based on a specific attribute not offered by default. Using custom attribute triggers, you can trigger a workflow to run for users based on when they move within your organization based on:\n+\n+- [Custom security attributes (CSA)](manage-workflow-custom-security-attribute.md)\n+- Directory extension attributes\n+- On-premises extension attributes (1-15)\n+- EmployeeOrgData attributes\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [Microsoft Entra ID Governance license](../includes/entra-entra-governance-license.md)]\n+\n+\n+## Use custom attribute triggers in a new workflow using the Microsoft Entra admin center\n+\n+To use custom attribute triggers in a new workflow, do the following steps:\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator) and [Attribute Assignment Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#attribute-assignment-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **Create a workflow**.\n+\n+1. On the Workflows page, select a workflow template that you want to use a custom security attribute as part of the scope for.\n+\n+1. Enter the basic information such as display name, description, and administration scope.\n+\n+1. Under **Trigger type** select **Attribute changes**.\n+\n+1. For Attribute, select the attribute trigger you want to trigger the workflow to run. \n+\n+1. Finish configuring the workflow and save it.  \n+    > [!NOTE]\n+    > Attribute changes are only detected for scheduled workflows.\n+\n+## Add a custom attribute to an existing workflow trigger using the Microsoft Entra admin center\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator) and [Attribute Assignment Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#attribute-assignment-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **workflows**.\n+    \n+1. Select the workflow that you want to add a custom attribute to the trigger of.\n+\n+1. On the workflow overview page, select **Execution conditions**.\n+\n+1. Under **Trigger details**, update the trigger with the custom attribute you want to use to trigger the workflow.\n+\n+1. Select **Save**.\n+\n+\n+## Custom attribute trigger considerations\n+\n+Currently the workflow and the workflow schedule must be enabled for attributes changes to be picked up and workflows executions to be scheduled. Once Lifecycle Workflows starts checking for attribute changes, the time it takes for changes to be picked up might be delayed for these custom attributes. While changes should be picked up within minutes, there are upstream processes that will add further delays after the user attribute changes, for example:\n+- Custom attributes might take up to 4 hours for their changes to be updated by the underlying service, however, once the custom attributes changes are propagated, Lifecycle Workflows should pick up the change within seconds.\n+- Once changes are picked up by Lifecycle workflows, workflow execution will occur in the next target run, according to the schedule for users that meet the workflow scope.\n+\n+## Attribute vs custom attribute processing timing\n+\n+The following image shows the potential differences in processing times for using regular attributes and custom attributes in the workflow trigger. \n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/workflow-custom-triggers/custom-attribute-timing.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of a comparison between regular and custom attribute processing timing in a workflow run.\":::\n+\n+\n+In example A, The workflow is scheduled to run when the department attribute changes, it's 12:00 pm and the next target runs are at 1pm and 2pm:\n+- At 12:10pm, the user department changes\n+- At 12:15 pm, the user is detected to be in scope of the workflow\n+- In the 1pm run, the user gets processed by the workflow\n+\n+\n+In example B, Workflow is scheduled to run when the TestCustomSecurityAttribute1 attribute changes, it's 12:00 pm and the next target runs are at 1pm and 2pm:\n+- At 12:10pm the TestCustomSecurityAttribute1 attribute changes for a user\n+- At 3:55 pm the change is passed to Lifecycle Workflows\n+- At 4:00 pm the user is detected to be in scope of the workflow (too late for the 4pm run)\n+- In the 5pm run, the user gets processed by the workflow\n+\n+For frequently asked question about using custom attribute triggers within lifecycle workflows, see: [Lifecycle workflows FAQs](workflows-faqs.md).\n+\n+\n+\n+## Next step\n+\n+- [Lifecycle workflows execution conditions and scheduling](lifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions.md)\n+- [Custom security attributes (CSA)](manage-workflow-custom-security-attribute.md)\n+\n+\n+"
  },
  {
    "sha": "0e5988f299227186b01c36ae34054bdf60cf157b",
    "filename": "docs/id-governance/workflows-faqs.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 17,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 17,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fworkflows-faqs.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fworkflows-faqs.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fworkflows-faqs.md?ref=03a276baeb24eb2d9a06dd6f0b031e40e4cc08ad",
    "patch": "@@ -58,6 +58,23 @@ Lifecycle workflows checks that the user is assigned the custom security attribu\n \n If a user is assigned a custom security attribute that has multiple values, and one of the values matches the value in the specified in rule expressions, the user matches the scope.\n \n+### Why can’t I see the custom attributes listed in the attributes change trigger?\n+\n+To see the expected attributes in the drop down list, you need to ensure the following:\n+\n+- The attributes must be configured and active\n+- For custom security attributes, you have the appropriate permissions\n+\n+\n+### Do workflows using custom attribute triggers always take 4 hours to process changes?\n+\n+No, the change processing time can vary depending on tenant change activity, timing and volume, with 4 hours expected to be the upper limit. We are working to optimize the timing as much as possible in hopes of reducing the time it takes.\n+\n+\n+### What happens if I have multiple workflows using custom attributes as triggers?\n+\n+If multiple workflows are using the same custom attribute as trigger, when that change is processed, those workflows will be processed at the same time. If multiple workflows are using different custom attributes as trigger, but the custom attributes updates occurred at the same time, then those workflows will be processed at the same time. If the attribute updates occur at different times, then the workflows processing may be different.\n+\n ## Next steps\n \n - [What are Lifecycle workflows?](what-are-lifecycle-workflows.md)"
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit updates documentation for Microsoft Entra Global Secure Access and ID Governance. Key changes include the removal of instructions for manually enabling multi-geo for the Japan region in Global Secure Access, along with the addition of a new article detailing how to configure Transport Layer Security (TLS) inspection settings. Within the ID Governance documentation, new content has been introduced to explain how to utilise custom attribute triggers for Lifecycle Workflows, along with updates to the FAQ section addressing custom attribute processing times and multiple workflow triggers.

  "sha": "78c55f5b18aa51de9e295e067c969c4ea699905f",
  "filename": "docs/architecture/backup-authentication-system.md",
  "status": "modified",
  "additions": 4,
  "deletions": 0,
  "changes": 4,
  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/84d7a7148789eee22e8669d6624fea1022994c0e/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fbackup-authentication-system.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/84d7a7148789eee22e8669d6624fea1022994c0e/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fbackup-authentication-system.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fbackup-authentication-system.md?ref=84d7a7148789eee22e8669d6624fea1022994c0e",
  "patch": "@@ -72,6 +72,10 @@ Certain other types of policies don't support use of the backup authentication s\n - Use of the [authentication methods policy](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-grant.md#require-authentication-strength).\n - Use of [classic Conditional Access policies](~/identity/conditional-access/policy-migration-mfa.md).\n \n+#### Evaluation of report-only Conditional Access policies\n+\n+If a request is processed by the backup authentication system, report-only Conditional Access policies will appear under the **Conditional Access** tab in **Entra ID** > **Monitoring & health** > **Sign-in logs** for that sign-in event, rather than in the **Report-only** tab. Note that even in this view, policies configured in report-only mode are never enforced. To see if tokens were issued via backup authentication system within your tenant, you can use the sign-in logs. In **Entra ID** > **Monitoring & health** > **Sign-in Logs**, add the filter `Token issuer type == Microsoft Entra Backup Auth` to display the logs processed by the backup authentication system. \n+\n ### Certificate revocation and the backup authentication system \n \n To enhance its resilience posture, the backup authentication system can't perform fresh revocation checks. Instead, it relies on the state of the certificate revocation list (CRL) check that's performed when the session was last backed up. If you need to revoke before this backup expires, you should explicitly revoke the session instead of waiting for the CRL.  "
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: The changes update the documentation for the backup authentication system. A new section has been added detailing the evaluation of report-only Conditional Access policies when processed by the backup authentication system. It clarifies that these policies will appear in the 'Conditional Access' tab of sign-in logs, not the 'Report-only' tab, and explains how to filter sign-in logs to identify events processed by the backup authentication system.

Continued ADAL usage bypasses modern security protections available only in MSAL, including Conditional Access enforcement, Continuous Access Evaluation (CAE), and advanced token protection. ADAL applications create security vulnerabilities by using weaker legacy authentication patterns, often calling deprecated Azure AD Graph endpoints, and preventing adoption of hardened authentication flows that could mitigate future security advisories. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Migrate applications to the Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL)](/entra/identity-platform/msal-migration)" }, { "sha": "740462f8225027712b962f8b212350770fcb12af", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21781.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21781.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21781.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21781.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 02/03/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Monitor and detect cyberthreats\n # 21781, 21782, 21783 are the same content. sfipillar: Protect engineering systems\n # category: Privileged access\n # risklevel: Low" }, { "sha": "a64f032b4b634606cda5e38b5b3fae5410839bce", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21813.md", "status": "added", "additions": 20, "deletions": 0, "changes": 20, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21813.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21813.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21813.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@\n+---\n+title: High Global Administrator to privileged user ratio\n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/23/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Privileged access\n+# risklevel: High\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Medium\n+---\n+When organizations maintain a disproportionately high ratio of Global Administrators relative to their total privileged user population, they expose themselves to significant security risks that threat actors might exploit through various attack vectors. Excessive Global Administrator assignments create multiple high-value targets for threat actors who might leverage initial access through credential compromise, phishing attacks, or insider threats to gain unrestricted access to the entire Microsoft Entra ID tenant and connected Microsoft 365 services. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Minimize the number of Global Administrator role assignments](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/best-practices#5-limit-the-number-of-global-administrators-to-less-than-5)" }, { "sha": "bb8d4126fbfb892972822ac96c950268ecbbc923", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21814.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21814.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21814.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21814.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 02/03/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n #
