sfipillar: Protect engineering systems\n # category: Devices\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "aa1d6d0043c5a36ad6c896f445ecb054620312a6", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21839.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21839.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21839.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21839.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/10/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Credential management\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "00c603fb8f141f9ef8318ad1fa43674712accced", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21840.md", "status": "added", "additions": 21, "deletions": 0, "changes": 21, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21840.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21840.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21840.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@\n+---\n+title: Security key attestation is enforced\n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/23/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Credential management\n+# risklevel: High\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Low\n+---\n+When security key attestation isn't enforced, threat actors can exploit weak or compromised authentication hardware to establish persistent presence within organizational environments. Without attestation validation, malicious actors can register unauthorized or counterfeit FIDO2 security keys that bypass hardware-backed security controls, enabling them to perform credential stuffing attacks using fabricated authenticators that mimic legitimate security keys. This initial access lets threat actors escalate privileges by using the trusted nature of hardware authentication methods, then move laterally through the environment by registering more compromised security keys on high-privilege accounts. The lack of attestation enforcement creates a pathway for threat actors to establish command and control through persistent hardware-based authentication methods, ultimately leading to data exfiltration or system compromise while maintaining the appearance of legitimate hardware-secured authentication throughout the attack chain. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Enable attestation enforcement through the Authentication methods policy configuration](/entra/identity/authentication/how-to-enable-passkey-fido2#enable-passkey-fido2-authentication-method).\n+- [Configure approved list of security keys by Authenticator Attestation Globally Unique Identifier (AAGUID)](/entra/identity/authentication/concept-fido2-hardware-vendor)." }, { "sha": "66d3f4561476feff3cf44a69e5a038a4d149fe53", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21841.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21841.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21841.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21841.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/09/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Credential management\n # risklevel: Medium" }, { "sha": "052b8d51286120c5744ca5c090c82dd0c91e5a5b", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21842.md", "status": "added", "additions": 22, "deletions": 0, "changes": 22, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21842.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21842.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21842.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@\n+---\n+title: Block administrators from using SSPR \n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/23/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Credential management, Privileged access\n+# risklevel: High\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Low\n+---\n+Self-Service Password Reset (SSPR) for administrators allows password changes to happen without strong secondary authentication factors or administrative oversight. Threat actors who compromise administrative credentials can use this capability to bypass other security controls and maintain persistent access to the environment.\n+\n+Once compromised, attackers can immediately reset the password to lock out legitimate administrators. They can then establish persistence, escalate privileges, and deploy malicious payloads undetected.\n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Disable SSPR for administrators by updating the authorization policy](/entra/identity/authentication/concept-sspr-policy#administrator-reset-policy-differences) " }, { "sha": "c6386b7a4dbbec0c80d94c258497f26280f65dce", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21844.md", "status": "added", "additions": 22, "deletions": 0, "changes": 22, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21844.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21844.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21844.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@\n+---\n+title: Block legacy Azure AD PowerShell module\n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Access control\n+# risklevel: Medium\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Medium\n+---\n+Threat actors frequently target legacy management interfaces such as the Azure AD PowerShell module (AzureAD and AzureADPreview), which don't support modern authentication, Conditional Access enforcement, or advanced audit logging. Continued use of these modules exposes the environment to risks including weak authentication, bypass of security controls, and incomplete visibility into administrative actions. Attackers can exploit these weaknesses to gain unauthorized access, escalate privileges, and perform malicious changes. \n+\n+Block the Azure AD PowerShell module and enforce the use of Microsoft Graph PowerShell or Microsoft Entra PowerShell to ensure that only secure, supported, and auditable management channels are available, which closes critical gaps in the attack chain. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Disable user sign-in for application](/entra/identity/enterprise-apps/disable-user-sign-in-portal)" }, { "sha": "e2a75551902dc13395575bb66e7e640c5f96d030", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21845.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21845.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21845.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21845.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/09/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Credential management\n # risklevel: Medium" }, { "sha": "78b3aa0d6fe58ecdc0094f0f68fa5b85ab1fcc49", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21846.md", "status": "added", "additions": 20, "deletions": 0, "changes": 20, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21846.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21846.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21846.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@\n+---\n+title: Restrict Temporary Access Pass to Single Use\n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/27/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Credential management\n+# risklevel: Medium\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Low\n+---\n+When Temporary Access Pass (TAP) is configured to allow multiple uses, threat actors who compromise the credential can reuse it repeatedly during its validity period, extending their unauthorized access window beyond the intended single bootstrapping event. This situation creates an extended opportunity for threat actors to establish persistence by registering additional strong authentication methods under the compromised account during the credential lifetime. A reusable TAP that falls into the wrong hands lets threat actors conduct reconnaissance activities across multiple sessions, gradually mapping the environment and identifying high-value targets while maintaining legitimate-looking access patterns. The compromised TAP can also serve as a reliable backdoor mechanism, allowing threat actors to maintain access even if other compromised credentials are detected and revoked, since the TAP appears as a legitimate administrative tool in security logs.\n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Configure Temporary Access Pass for one-time use in authentication methods policy](/entra/identity/authentication/howto-authentication-temporary-access-pass#enable-the-temporary-access-pass-policy) " }, { "sha": "2375f6d8983f4abf2988233777cffcda0751ac79", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21847.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21847.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21847.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21847.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 08/19/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Credential management\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "518206ca8af9c210f5cad1ca05b50d3189741e33", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21848.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21848.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21848.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21848.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/09/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Credential management\n # risklevel: Medium" }, { "sha": "be31378bbb0f8f35f0275df33c575a2cc42956e6", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21849.md", "status": "added", "additions": 20, "deletions": 0, "changes": 20, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21849.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21849.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21849.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@\n+---\n+title: Smart lockout duration is set to a minimum of 60 \n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/27/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Credential management\n+# risklevel: Medium\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Low\n+---\n+When Smart Lockout duration is configured below the default 60 seconds, threat actors can exploit shortened lockout periods to conduct password spray and credential stuffing attacks more effectively. Reduced lockout windows allow attackers to resume authentication attempts more rapidly, increasing their success probability while potentially evading detection systems that rely on longer observation periods. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Set Smart Lockout duration to 60 seconds or higher](/entra/identity/authentication/howto-password-smart-lockout#manage-microsoft-entra-smart-lockout-values)" }, { "sha": "7b6bd21972d1ed493d8c8fc24d04430cb6fdaa34", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21850.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21850.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21850.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21850.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/07/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Monitor and detect cyberthreats\n # category: Monitoring\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "f795bf560f5968f8646da181d2a2a222ec699c27", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21862.md", "status": "added", "additions": 21, "deletions": 0, "changes": 21, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21862.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21862.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21862.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@\n+---\n+title: All risky workload identities are triaged\n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P2\n+# sfipillar: Monitor and detect cyberthreats\n+# category: Monitoring\n+# risklevel: High\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: High\n+---\n+Compromised workload identities (service principals and applications) allow threat actors to gain persistent access without user interaction or multifactor authentication. Microsoft Entra ID Protection monitors these identities for suspicious activities like leaked credentials, anomalous API traffic, and malicious applications. Unaddressed risky workload identities enable privilege escalation, lateral movement, data exfiltration, and persistent backdoors that bypass traditional security controls. Organizations must systematically investigate and remediate these risks to prevent unauthorized access. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Investigate and remediate risky workload identities](/entra/id-protection/concept-workload-identity-risk#investigate-risky-workload-identities)\n+- [Apply Conditional Access policies for workload identities](/entra/identity/conditional-access/workload-identity)" }, { "sha": "5afd3d33578d7276b3e0713b62dd6e005ee092b2", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21863.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21863.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21863.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21863.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 03/05/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P2\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Access control\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "be6b292a2924765ee430f5a21ab817a5f824c90d", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21874.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21874.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21874.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21874.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/10/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n # sfipillar: Protect tenants and isolate production systems\n # category: External collaboration\n # risklevel: Medium" }, { "sha": "92667c41d514608fc4ff9fb9526bcf1e7f66b3de", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21875.md", "status": "added", "additions": 21, "deletions": 0, "changes": 21, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21875.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21875.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21875.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@\n+---\n+title: All entitlement management assignment policies that apply to external users require connected organizations \n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P2, Governance\n+# sfipillar: Protect tenants and isolate production systems\n+# category: External collaboration\n+# risklevel: Medium\n+# userimpact: Medium\n+# implementationcost: Medium\n+---\n+Access packages configured to allow \"All users\" instead of specific connected organizations expose your organization to uncontrolled external access. Threat actors can exploit this by requesting access through compromised external accounts from unauthorized organizations, bypassing the principle of least privilege. This enables initial access, reconnaissance, privilege escalation, and lateral movement within your environment. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Define trusted organizations as connected organizations](/entra/id-governance/entitlement-management-organization#view-the-list-of-connected-organizations)\n+- [Configure access packages to only allow specific connected organizations](/entra/id-governance/entitlement-management-access-package-create#allow-users-not-in-your-directory-to-request-the-access-package)" }, { "sha": "bf47da75524b17436eea9ceef4e5ecdc0e69842b", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21877.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21877.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21877.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21877.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 07/07/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n # sfipillar: Protect tenants and isolate production systems\n # category: Application management \n # risklevel: Medium" }, { "sha": "4928350b78d3a517309f2b2879f8f91d297207f2", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21878.md", "status": "added", "additions": 20, "deletions": 0, "changes": 20, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21878.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21878.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21878.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@\n+---\n+title: All entitlement management policies have an expiration date \n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P2, Governance\n+# sfipillar: Protect tenants and isolate production systems\n+# category: Identity governance\n+# risklevel: Medium\n+# userimpact: Medium\n+# implementationcost: Medium\n+---\n+Entitlement management policies without expiration dates create persistent access that threat actors can exploit. When user assignments lack time bounds, compromised credentials maintain indefinite access, enabling attackers to establish persistence, escalate privileges through additional access packages, and conduct long-term malicious activities while remaining undetected. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Configure expiration settings for access packages](/entra/id-governance/entitlement-management-access-package-lifecycle-policy#specify-a-lifecycle)\n\\ No newline at end of file" }, { "sha": "dd928b3ba246d35a4a54d5e9f861e29b27b76331", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21883.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21883.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21883.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21883.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 06/16/2025\n manager: dougeby\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Workload\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Access control\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "266f2bc0db2c2a02525ff94db4d20b8c1b58d7c3", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21893.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21893.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21893.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21893.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/07/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P2\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Access control\n # risklevel: Low" }, { "sha": "ff36c3ea63e47c0b0ebcb988d04ce67f810d5f12", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21896.md", "status": "added", "additions": 21, "deletions": 0, "changes": 21, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21896.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21896.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21896.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@\n+---\n+title: Service principals don't have certificates or credentials associated with them \n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Application management\n+# risklevel: Medium\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Medium\n+---\n+Service principals without proper authentication credentials (certificates or client secrets) create security vulnerabilities that allow threat actors to impersonate these identities. This can lead to unauthorized access, lateral movement within your environment, privilege escalation, and persistent access that's difficult to detect and remediate. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- For your organization's service principals: [Add certificates or client secrets to the app registration](/entra/identity-platform/how-to-add-credentials)\n+- For external service principals: Review and remove any unnecessary credentials to reduce security risk" }, { "sha": "277b9470df1496e2022fa7629f5ac232ad63d699", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21929.md", "status": "added", "additions": 21, "deletions": 0, "changes": 21, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21929.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21929.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21929.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@\n+---\n+title: All entitlement management packages that apply to guests have expirations or access reviews configured in their assignment policies\n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P2, Governance\n+# sfipillar: Protect tenants and isolate production systems\n+# category: Identity governance\n+# risklevel: Medium\n+# userimpact: Medium\n+# implementationcost: Medium\n+---\n+Access packages for guest users without expiration dates or access reviews allow indefinite access to organizational resources. Compromised or stale guest accounts enable threat actors to maintain persistent, undetected access for lateral movement, privilege escalation, and data exfiltration. Without periodic validation, organizations cannot identify when business relationships change or when guest access is no longer needed. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Configure lifecycle settings](/entra/id-governance/entitlement-management-access-package-lifecycle-policy)\n+- [Configure access reviews](/entra/id-governance/entitlement-management-access-reviews-create)" }, { "sha": "ef0717ce1fe97661c1a23955dcbc89faa77f5992", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21953.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21953.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21953.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21953.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 10/07/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Devices\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "1af39fce3d036fa3a4b485760665424ad7ca344f", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21955.md", "status": "added", "additions": 20, "deletions": 0, "changes": 20, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21955.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21955.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21955.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@\n+---\n+title: Manage the local administrators on Microsoft Entra joined devices \n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/27/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n+# sfipillar: Protect tenants and isolate production systems\n+# category: Devices\n+# risklevel: High\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Low\n+---\n+When local administrators on Microsoft Entra joined devices aren't properly managed, threat actors with compromised credentials can execute device takeover attacks by removing organizational administrators and disabling the device's connection to Microsoft Entra. This lack of control results in complete loss of organizational control, creating orphaned assets that can't be managed or recovered.\n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Manage the local administrators on Microsoft Entra joined devices](/entra/identity/devices/assign-local-admin#manage-the-microsoft-entra-joined-device-local-administrator-role)" }, { "sha": "06173a3c2a652362b1e8aab7163c50bd7ec31f28", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/21985.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21985.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21985.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F21985.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -6,6 +6,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 06/27/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n # category: Monitoring\n # risklevel: High" }, { "sha": "21f5974c7bf58e86fe7700639b91410cf829864f", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/23183.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 0, "changes": 1, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F23183.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F23183.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F23183.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n ms.date: 04/24/2025\n ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: P1\n # sfipillar: Protect engineering systems\n # 21885, 23183 are similar content.\n # category: Application management" }, { "sha": "d16b0ab263646c53c9a3436810877470cc58e4d5", "filename": "docs/includes/secure-recommendations/24570.md", "status": "added", "additions": 21, "deletions": 0, "changes": 21, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F24570.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F24570.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fsecure-recommendations%2F24570.md?ref=5c64f707f390579f5e1547cc1f5c41fc3315f358", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@\n+---\n+title: Entra Connect Sync is configured with Service Principal Credentials \n+ms.author: joflore\n+author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.topic: include\n+ms.date: 10/28/2025\n+ms.custom: Identity-Secure-Recommendation\n+# minimumlicense: Free\n+# sfipillar: Protect identities and secrets\n+# category: Hybrid infrastructure\n+# risklevel: High\n+# userimpact: Low\n+# implementationcost: Medium\n+---\n+Microsoft Entra Connect Sync using user accounts instead of service principals creates security vulnerabilities. Legacy user account authentication with passwords is more susceptible to credential theft and password attacks than service principal authentication with certificates. Compromised connector accounts allow threat actors to manipulate identity synchronization, create backdoor accounts, escalate privileges, or disrupt hybrid identity infrastructure. \n+\n+**Remediation action**\n+\n+- [Configure service principal authentication for Entra Connect](/entra/identity/hybrid/connect/authenticate-application-id?tabs=default#onboard-to-application-based-authentication)\n+- [Remove legacy Directory Synchronization Accounts](/entra/identity/hybrid/connect/authenticate-application-id?tabs=default#remove-a-legacy-service-account)" } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit addresses security configurations and recommendations within Microsoft Entra ID. It updates documentation to reflect license changes for various security checks, making many features available without specific premium licenses. Additionally, several new security recommendations and best practices have been introduced, focusing on areas like workload identity security, temporary access pass usage, and the blocking of legacy PowerShell modules. The changes also refine existing security recommendations related to service principals and entitlement management.

  {

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/7dc3f58ba1f3e0504b504807003bcc8b8e20cce8/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fbackup-authentication-system.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fbackup-authentication-system.md?ref=7dc3f58ba1f3e0504b504807003bcc8b8e20cce8",
    "patch": "@@ -72,7 +72,7 @@ Certain other types of policies don't support use of the backup authentication s\n - Use of the [authentication methods policy](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-grant.md#require-authentication-strength).\n - Use of [classic Conditional Access policies](~/identity/conditional-access/policy-migration-mfa.md).\n \n-### How does certificate revocation work in an outage? \n+### Certificate revocation and the backup authentication system \n \n To enhance its resilience posture, the backup authentication system can't perform fresh revocation checks. Instead, it relies on the state of the certificate revocation list (CRL) check that's performed when the session was last backed up. If you need to revoke before this backup expires, you should explicitly revoke the session instead of waiting for the CRL.  \n "
  },

    "patch": "@@ -267,6 +267,9 @@ The following table shows the minimum requirements for the Microsoft Entra Conne\n | 300,000–600,000 |1.6 GHz |32 GB |450 GB |\n | More than 600,000 |1.6 GHz |32 GB |500 GB |\n \n+The specifications listed above represent combined hardware requirements for the Microsoft Entra Connect server hosting both the synchronization application and the SQL Server database (either the built-in SQL Express or a full SQL Server instance installed locally).\n+If the SQL Server database is hosted remotely on a separate server, the Entra Connect application server may require fewer resources, while the SQL Server will need its own compute, memory, and storage capacity according to SQL Server sizing best practices.\n+\n The minimum requirements for computers running AD FS or Web Application Proxy servers are:\n \n * CPU: Dual core 1.6 GHz or higher"

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates two documentation files. Firstly, it amends a heading in "backup-authentication-system.md" for clarity regarding certificate revocation. Secondly, it adds a clarification to "how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md" about hardware specifications, specifying that listed requirements are for a combined server and that a remote SQL Server will have its own resource needs.

{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "f013846f51cfea439e905567f48146c0fd92d194",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/concept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 8,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 8,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -38,6 +38,14 @@ Email sign-up is enabled by default in your local account identity provider sett\n \n When you [create a sign-up and sign-in user flow](how-to-user-flow-sign-up-sign-in-customers.md#create-and-customize-a-user-flow), **Email with password** is the default option.\n \n+## Username or alias sign-in (preview)\n+\n+You can enable users who sign in with a local account (email and password) to sign in with an [alias or username](how-to-sign-in-alias.md) in addition to their email address. This allows users to authenticate using either their email address or an alternative identifier or both. The alternative identifier can be a customer ID, membership ID, insurance number, or frequent flyer number or anything similar that you want to use as a username.\n+\n+When you enable username sign-in, users can choose to sign in with either their email address or their username. If they choose to sign in with their username, they will be prompted to enter a password, similar to Email and password sign-in. If you [enable password reset](how-to-customize-branding-customers.md#to-customize-self-service-password-reset), users can reset their password by selecting the password reset link on the sign-in page.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/alias-sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the username sign-in option.\":::\n+\n ## Email with one-time passcode sign-in\n \n Email with one-time passcode is an option in your local account identity provider settings. With this option, the user signs in with a temporary passcode instead of a stored password each time they sign in."
  },
  {
    "sha": "3c79584e1e46edb2b57e3981a282f2dc5a6eb114",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/how-to-sign-in-alias.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 224,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 224,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-sign-in-alias.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-sign-in-alias.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-sign-in-alias.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,224 @@\n+---\n+title: Sign in with alias\n+description: Learn how to Sign in with alias/username with External ID for customer identity and access management (CIAM). Get detailed steps to enable username as a sign-in identifier and create users with both email address and username. \n+ms.author: cmulligan\n+author: csmulligan\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.service: entra-external-id \n+ms.subservice: external\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 09/10/2025\n+ms.custom: it-pro\n+\n+#Customer intent: As a dev, devops, or it admin, I want to learn about how to enable sign in with alias/username through the Microsoft Entra admin center and Graph API.\n+---\n+# Sign in with an alias or username (preview)\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [applies-to-external-only](../includes/applies-to-external-only.md)]\n+\n+You can allow users who sign in with an email address and password to also sign in with a username and password. The username, also called an alternate sign-in identifier, can be a customer ID, account number, or another identifier that you choose to use as a username.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/username-login-option.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the username sign-in option.\":::\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+- If you haven't already created your own Microsoft Entra external tenant, [create one now](how-to-create-external-tenant-portal.md).\n+- [Register an app](/entra/identity-platform/quickstart-register-app)\n+- [Create a user flow](how-to-user-flow-sign-up-sign-in-customers.md)\n+- [Add your application](how-to-user-flow-add-application.md) to the user flow.\n+\n+## Enable username in sign-in identifier policy\n+\n+To enable username as a sign-in identifier, first enable the sign-in identifier policy in the Microsoft Entra admin center. UserPrincipalName (UPN) and email address are selected by default. Once username is also  enabled, users who have been assigned a username will be able to sign in using either their email address or username.\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Authentication Policy Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#authentication-policy-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to your external tenant from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. Browse to **Sign-in identifiers** either from **Entra ID** > **External Identities** or from **Entra ID** > **Authentication methods**.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/sign-in-identifiers-option.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Sign-in identifiers option in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Sign-in identifiers** page, enable **Username** as a sign-in identifier.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/enable-username.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of enabling username in the Sign-in identifiers option in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Save** at the top of the page.\n+\n+### Enable custom username validation (optional)\n+\n+You can also validate usernames against a custom regular expression. In the modal window, you can specify up to two regular expressions. There’s no built-in validation for custom regular expressions, apart from ensuring they don’t match the format of an email address. Authentication may fail at runtime if the provided value doesn’t match the regex or if the regex itself is invalid.\n+\n+1. To enable custom username validation, select **Customize** and **Enable** and specify the regex patterns.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/enable-custom-username.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of enabling custom username in the Sign-in identifiers option in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Save** at the bottom of the modal window.\n+\n+## Create users with username in the admin center\n+\n+You can create external users with both email address and username as sign-in identifiers using either the Microsoft Entra admin center or the Microsoft Graph API. This section describes creating users in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\n+ \n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Authentication Policy Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#authentication-policy-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to your external tenant from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. In your external tenant, browse to **Entra ID** > **Users**.\n+1. Select **+ New user** > **Create external user**.\n+1. Next to **Identities**, enter values for both **Email** and **User Name** sign-in methods. The selection order doesn’t matter.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/sign-in-method-dropdown.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Sign-in method dropdown in the Create external user pane in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Properties** tab, specify the email attribute for the user.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/email-attribute.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Email attribute field in the Create external user pane in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Review + create** to create the user.\n+\n+## Update existing users to add a username in the admin center\n+\n+Follow these steps to add a username to an existing external user in the Microsoft Entra admin center. Username can only be added to external users with email and password accounts.\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Authentication Policy Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#authentication-policy-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to your external tenant from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. In your external tenant, browse to **Entra ID** > **Users**.\n+1. Select the external user you want to update.\n+1. In the user pane, select **Edit properties**.\n+1. On the **Identity** tab, in the **Identities** section select **+ Add identity**.\n+1. Select **User Name** from the dropdown and enter the username you want to assign to the user.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/edit-user-to-add-alias.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of adding username to an existing user in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Save** to apply the changes.\n+\n+## Create users with username with the Microsoft Graph API\n+\n+After you sign in to the [MS Graph explorer](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/graph-explorer), you can use the [Users API](/graph/api/user-post-users) to create users with both email address and username as sign-in identifiers. You can also use the Users API to [add a username](#add-a-username-to-existing-users-with-the-microsoft-graph-api) to an existing user.\n+The following request example shows how to create a user with both email address and username as sign-in identifiers.\n+\n+```http\n+POST https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users\n+Content-type: application/json\n+{\n+    \"displayName\": \"Test User\",\n+    \"identities\": [\n+        {\n+            \"signInType\": \"emailAddress\",\n+            \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+            \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\"\n+        },\n+        {\n+            \"signInType\": \"username\",\n+            \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+            \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan123\"\n+        }\n+    ],\n+    \"mail\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\",\n+    \"passwordProfile\": {\n+        \"password\": \"passwordValue\",\n+        \"forceChangePasswordNextSignIn\": false\n+    },\n+    \"passwordPolicies\": \"DisablePasswordExpiration\"\n+}\n+```\n+\n+## Add a username to existing users with the Microsoft Graph API\n+\n+You can also add a username to an existing external user.\n+\n+### Step 1: Get the user details\n+\n+Use `$filter` to get the user object, and `$select` to return the ID and `identities[]` properties. The following request example shows how to retrieve a user account using the email address as a sign-in identifier.\n+\n+```http\n+GET https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users?$select=displayName,id,identities&$filter=identities/any(c:c/issuerAssignedId eq 'dylan@woodgrovebank.com' and c/issuer eq 'contoso.onmicrosoft.com')\n+```\n+\n+The following response example shows the response with the user details.\n+\n+```http\n+HTTP/1.1 200 OK\n+Content-type: application/json\n+ \n+{\n+    \"@odata.context\": \"https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/$metadata#users(displayName,id,identities)\",\n+    \"value\": [\n+        {\n+            \"displayName\": \"ciam test 1\",\n+            \"id\": \"0daaf9dd-3583-4cd4-8934-a2ffd0490287\",\n+            \"identities\": [\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"userPrincipalName\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"0daaf9dd-3583-4cd4-8934-a2ffd0490287@contoso.onmicrosoft.com\"\n+                },\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"emailAddress\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\"\n+                }\n+            ]\n+        }\n+    ]\n+}\n+```\n+\n+### Step 2: Update the user details\n+\n+Once you have the user details from the query above, you can update the `identities[]` property of the user. You must replace the entire `identities[]` property of the user.\n+\n+The following request example shows how to update the `identities[]` property of the user to add a username.\n+\n+```http\n+POST https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/00aa00aa-bb11-cc22-dd33-44ee44ee44ee\n+Content-type: application/json \n+{\n+            \"identities\": [\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"userPrincipalName\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"00aa00aa-bb11-cc22-dd33-44ee44ee44ee@contoso.onmicrosoft.com\"\n+                },\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"emailAddress\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\"\n+                },\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"userName\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan1234\"\n+                }\n+            ]\n+}\n+```\n+\n+## Test signing in with the alias or username\n+\n+You can test signing in with the email address and username you assigned to the user you created using the [Run user flow](how-to-test-user-flows.md) feature.\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> The `identities[]` property on a user object isn’t enforced by the Microsoft Entra sign-in identifiers policy. While administrators can assign values to a user’s `identities[]` property, authentication is determined by the configured sign-in identifier policy. In other words, if a sign-in type is specified for a user but isn't enabled in the policy, the authentication attempt fails at runtime. For example, a user might be assigned the username *User1234*, but if the username sign-in method isn't enabled in the policy, the user won't be able to sign in using that username.  \n+\n+## Customize the sign-in page (optional)\n+\n+You can customize the sign-in page to provide a better experience for your users. You can customize the hint text of the identifier field on the sign-in page and localize other strings related to username.\n+\n+### Customize the hint text of the identifier field on the sign-in page\n+\n+You can customize the hint text of identifier field on the sign-in page for all apps via [Custom branding](/entra/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-branding-customers#to-customize-the-sign-in-form).\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Organizational Branding Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to the external tenant you created earlier from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. Browse to **Company branding** either by using the search bar or by navigating to **Entra ID** > **Custom Branding**.\n+1. Select **Edit** to modify the branding.\n+1. In the **Sign-in form** tab, you can customize the hint text of identifier field on the sign-in page. For example, you can change it to *Email address or Member ID*.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/edit-username-hint.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of customizing the username hint text  in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Review + save** to save your changes.\n+\n+### Customize and localize other strings related to username\n+\n+You can customize and localize other strings related to an end user's experience of signing in with a username by uploading a language file. For more information, see [Add language customization to a user flow](/entra/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-languages-customers#add-language-customization-to-a-user-flow).\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- You can use the [Users API](/graph/api/user-post-users) to create users with both email address and username with Microsoft Graph.\n+- You can [customize the look and feel of the authentication experience for the external tenant](/entra/external-id/customers/concept-branding-customers#add-language-customization-to-a-user-flow)."
  },

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-authentication-external-method-manage.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-authentication-external-method-manage.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-authentication-external-method-manage.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -172,6 +172,16 @@ EAMs and custom controls can operate in parallel. Microsoft recommends that admi\n \n Include a test group of users for each policy, but not both. If a user is included in both policies, or any policy with both conditions, the user has to satisfy MFA during sign-in. They also have to satisfy the custom control, which makes them redirected to the external provider a second time.\n \n+## FAQ\n+### 1. Why doesn't External Authentication Methods (EAM) work on Windows 10 during device setup?\n+**Answer:**  \n+If you are setting up a device running **Windows 10** using an **EAM-only identity**, you may encounter an issue where the **Out-of-Box (OOB) setup experience** fails and prevents you from proceeding with sign-in.\n+\n+This behavior occurs because **Windows 10 does not natively support EAM during OOBE (Out-of-Box Experience)**.  \n+Microsoft no longer supports Windows 10 (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/end-of-support?msockid=26a3312b6b246f501ec624846a4f6e11), and there are **no plans to extend EAM support** to it.\n+\n+To use External Authentication Methods for sign-in, **upgrade to Windows 11**\n+\n ## Next steps\n \n For more information about how to manage authentication methods, see [Manage authentication methods for Microsoft Entra ID](/entra/identity/authentication/concept-authentication-methods-manage)."

  {
    "sha": "2c58e46a403b24ab365aef75dd6cfa9998506fbb",
    "filename": "docs/identity/devices/browser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 72,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 72,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,72 @@\n+---\n+title: Browser access guidance for third party mobile device management providers\n+description: As an MDM provider, I want to update my Android Device policy to enable browser access during device registration so that my customers can access CA-protected resources seamlessly.\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.subservice: devices\n+ms.topic: reference\n+ms.date: 10/15/2025\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+author: owinfreyATL\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.reviewer: zhvolosh\n+\n+---\n+\n+\n+# Browser access guidance for third party mobile device management providers\n+\n+Update your [Android Device policy](https://developers.google.com/android/management/reference/rest/v1/enterprises.policies) resource to support automatically enabling browser access during device registration.\n+\n+As announced in September 2024 and November 2025 in the What’s New in Microsoft Entra blog, we're automatically enabling browser access by default for Android users. This change is part of hardening all Microsoft products as part of the [Secure Future Initiative](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-cloud/resources/secure-future-initiative). As part of this initiative, we're eliminating the mechanism to export device registration keys from device storage after registration completes. \n+\n+\n+This change means that users of Android devices will no longer be able to modify their browser access settings in Authenticator app or Company Portal after their device has been registered in Microsoft Entra ID. Instead, Android users have browser access enabled by default. \n+\n+## If you're an MDM provider\n+\n+\n+We request that you modify your [Android Device policy](https://developers.google.com/android/management/reference/rest/v1/enterprises.policies) resource to support enabling browser access during device registration. The policy resource is used to create and save groups of device and app management settings for your customers to apply to devices.\n+\n+To enable browser access on behalf of your customers, you need to either create or modify an existing policy to provide a delegated certificate to the Authenticator app and Company Portal. \n+\n+The following is an example of a policy: \n+\n+**Policy example for setting delegated scope CERT_INSTALL for authenticator**\n+\n+\n+```html\n+\"applications\": [{\n+    \"packageName\": \"com.azure.authenticator\"\n+    \"installType\": \"REQUIRED_FOR_SETUP\"\n+    \"delegatedScopes\": [\n+        \"CERT_INSTALL\"\n+      ]   \n+}],\n+```\n+\n+CERT_INSTALL - Grants access to certificate installation and management. - https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/admin/DevicePolicyManager#DELEGATION_CERT_INSTALL\n+\n+\n+More information can be found here: [Android MDM create and apply policy](https://microsoft.sharepoint-df.com/:w:/t/AzureADDevices/EUBvQT-nqK1GhgrNwoOsUbYBUfCGH0uZM7bLQBPS56bggw?e=UvUuF0).\n+\n+\n+If you fail to make the requested change, your end users encounter the following behavior: \n+\n+-\tIf the device is registered in Microsoft Entra with Browser Access enabled\n+    - No effect \n+-\tIf the device is registered in Microsoft Entra but Browser Access isn't enabled: \n+    - Access to CA-protected resources on a non Microsoft Edge browser will be blocked.\n+    - If the user requires access to CA-protected resources on a web browser, they'll have to use Microsoft Edge. \n+-\tIf the device is undergoing registration for the first time: \n+    - The user is prompted to choose a certificate type and name their certificate as part of the registration flow. \n+    - This certificate is used to enable browser access. \n+    - Once this certificate is on the device, browser access is enabled, and the user can access CA-protected resources on any browser of their choice. \n+\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/browser-access-guidance-third-party-devices/device-certificates.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of setting device certificates.\" lightbox=\"media/browser-access-guidance-third-party-devices/device-certificates.png\":::\n+\n+\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- [What's new in Microsoft Entra - September 2024](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/microsoft-entra-blog/whats-new-in-microsoft-entra---september-2024/4253153)"
  },

    "filename": "docs/identity/enterprise-apps/disable-user-sign-in-portal.md",

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fdisable-user-sign-in-portal.md",

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fdisable-user-sign-in-portal.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ zone_pivot_groups: enterprise-apps-all\n ---\n # Disable user sign-in for an application\n \n-There might be situations while configuring or managing an application where you don't want tokens to be issued for an application. Or, you might want to block an application that you don't want your employees to try to access. To block user access to an application, you can disable user sign-in for the application, which prevents all tokens from being issued for that application.\n+There might be situations while configuring or managing an application where you don't want tokens to be issued for an application. Or, you might want to block an application that you don't want your employees to try to access, like the deprecated Azure AD PowerShell modules (AppID 1b730954-1685-4b74-9bfd-dac224a7b894). To block user access to an application, you can disable user sign-in for the application, which prevents all tokens from being issued for that application.\n \n In this article, you learn how to prevent users from signing in to an application in Microsoft Entra ID through both the Microsoft Entra admin center and PowerShell. If you're looking for how to block specific users from accessing an application, use [user or group assignment](./assign-user-or-group-access-portal.md).\n "
  },

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fmanage-app-consent-policies.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fmanage-app-consent-policies.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fmanage-app-consent-policies.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ The setting labeled \"Let Microsoft manage your consent settings,\" the Microsoft\n Updates to this consent policy will have at least 30 days of given notice.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> Starting at the end of October 2025, the Microsoft managed policy will be updated to require admin consent for the following MS Graph permissions: Mail.Read, Mail.ReadWrite, Mail.ReadBasic, Mail.Read.Shared, Mail.ReadBasic.Shared, Mail.ReadWrite.Shared, MailboxItem.Read, Calendars.Read, Calendars.ReadBasic, Calendars.ReadWrite, Calendars.Read.Shared, Calendars.ReadBasic.Shared, Calendars.ReadWrite.Shared, Chat.Read, Chat.ReadWrite, ChannelMessage.Read.All,OnlineMeetings.Read, OnlineMeetings.ReadWrite, OnlineMeetingTranscript.Read.All, OnlineMeetingsRecording.Read.All. At the end of November 2025, this will expand to include EAS.AccessAsUser.All, EWS.AccessAsUser.All, IMAP.AcessAsUser.All, POP.AccessAsUser.All\n+> Starting at the end of October 2025, the Microsoft managed policy will be updated to require admin consent for the following MS Graph permissions: Mail.Read, Mail.ReadWrite, Mail.ReadBasic, Mail.Read.Shared, Mail.ReadBasic.Shared, Mail.ReadWrite.Shared, MailboxItem.Read, Calendars.Read, Calendars.ReadBasic, Calendars.ReadWrite, Calendars.Read.Shared, Calendars.ReadBasic.Shared, Calendars.ReadWrite.Shared, Chat.Read, Chat.ReadWrite, ChannelMessage.Read.All, OnlineMeetings.Read, OnlineMeetings.ReadWrite, OnlineMeetingTranscript.Read.All, OnlineMeetingRecording.Read.All. At the end of November 2025, this will expand to include EAS.AccessAsUser.All, EWS.AccessAsUser.All, IMAP.AccessAsUser.All, POP.AccessAsUser.All\n \n \n "
  },

ai_summary.Response: New documentation has been added for enabling users to sign in with a username or alias in addition to their email address, with comprehensive guides on configuration and user management via the Microsoft Entra admin centre and Graph API. Updates also include guidance for third-party mobile device management providers regarding browser access during device registration, and a clarification on an FAQ related to external authentication methods on Windows 10. Minor revisions have been made to existing documentation concerning disabling user sign-in for applications and app consent policies, along with some reviewer removals.

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the documentation regarding app consent policies in Microsoft Entra ID. It clarifies that starting from October 2025, the Microsoft-managed policy will require admin consent for specific Microsoft Graph permissions related to Mail, Calendars, Chat, and Online Meetings. This requirement will be extended to include EAS, EWS, IMAP, and POP permissions at the end of November 2025.

ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the changes:

The documentation for managing app consent policies has been updated to reflect upcoming changes to the Microsoft-managed consent policy. Starting at the end of October 2025, specific Microsoft Graph API permissions related to email and calendar access will require admin consent. This will be further expanded in November 2025 to include permissions for Exchange ActiveSync, Exchange Web Services, IMAP, and POP access.

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8/docs%2Fid-protection%2Fhowto-identity-protection-remediate-unblock.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-protection%2Fhowto-identity-protection-remediate-unblock.md?ref=41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8",
    "patch": "@@ -81,8 +81,6 @@ Some situations require an IT administrator to manually remediate sign-in or use\n - Confirm the user is compromised and take action to secure the account.\n - Unblock the user.\n \n-You can also [remediate in Microsoft Defender for Identity](/defender-for-identity/remediation-actions).\n-\n ### Generate a temporary password\n \n By generating a temporary password, you can immediately bring an identity back into a safe state. This method requires contacting the affected users because they need to know what the temporary password is. Because the password is temporary, the user is prompted to change the password to something new during the next sign-in."
  },
  {
    "sha": "28b667da9f8c0089447bf5f53ef07e7a3c97be08",
    "filename": "docs/identity/users/licensing-service-plan-reference.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8/docs%2Fidentity%2Fusers%2Flicensing-service-plan-reference.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8/docs%2Fidentity%2Fusers%2Flicensing-service-plan-reference.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fusers%2Flicensing-service-plan-reference.md?ref=41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8",
    "patch": "@@ -644,9 +644,9 @@ When [managing licenses in the Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Mic\n \n Some products contain service plans that cannot be assigned to the same user at the same time. For example, if you have *Office 365 E1* and *Office 365 E3* in your tenant, and you try to assign both licenses to the same user, the operation fails. This is because the E3 product contains the following service plans that conflict with their E1 counterparts:\n \n--   SharePoint Online (Plan 2) conflicts with SharePoint Online (Plan 1).\n -   Exchange Online (Plan 2) conflicts with Exchange Online (Plan 1).\n \n+Also, It is not recommended to assign both SharePoint Online (Plan 1) and SharePoint Online (Plan 2) simultaneously.\n When using group-based licensing, you experience [this error condition](licensing-groups-resolve-problems.md#conflicting-service-plans). When using PowerShell, you see the *MutuallyExclusiveViolation* error.\n \n This section lists the most common service plans that are mutually exclusive, grouped by service type. You can use this information to plan your license deployment and avoid assignment errors. These tables are for reference purposes and are accurate only as of the date when this article was last updated. Microsoft does not plan to update them for newly added services periodically."
  },
  {
    "sha": "e9804f653a000872b2bb9a031622237afd2d93f5",
    "filename": "docs/security-copilot/conditional-access-agent-optimization-chat.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 35,
    "deletions": 7,
    "changes": 42,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8/docs%2Fsecurity-copilot%2Fconditional-access-agent-optimization-chat.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8/docs%2Fsecurity-copilot%2Fconditional-access-agent-optimization-chat.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fsecurity-copilot%2Fconditional-access-agent-optimization-chat.md?ref=41674b3385c2b451508c87e3cf85556b319fd2d8",
    "patch": "@@ -13,13 +13,10 @@ ms.topic: how-to\n ms.custom: security-copilot\n ms.collection: msec-ai-copilot\n ---\n-# Chat with the Conditional Access optimization agent (preview)\n+# Chat with the Conditional Access optimization agent\n \n The Conditional Access optimization agent features a conversational interface that enables administrators to interact with the agent using natural language. This chat capability makes it easier to understand suggestions, request more information, and update policy details generated by the agent. With the chat capability, you can focus only on the details of the policy suggestion that you need so you can make the right decision. \n- \n-> [!IMPORTANT]\n-> The chat capability in the Conditional Access Optimization agent is currently in PREVIEW.\n-> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before release. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.\n+\n \n ## Prerequisites\n \n@@ -36,6 +33,14 @@ The Conditional Access optimization agent features a conversational interface th\n \n With the Conditional Access optimization agent chat interface, you can use natural language to get more information on a policy suggestion or have the agent present the suggestions in a different order. \n \n+### Explain agent capabilities\n+\n+The Conditional Access Optimization Agent provides several capabilities, so it might help to ask the agent what it can do and how it assists with policy management. The agent can explain its supported functions.\n+\n+Sample prompts:\n+- *What can the Conditional Access Optimization Agent help me with?*\n+- *Summarize your capabilities.*\n+\n ### Prioritize suggestions\n \n With the chat capability you can ask the agent to help you prioritize the suggestions. The agent compares the potential impact of the policy changes and provides a ranked list of suggestions based on [Zero Trust principles](/security/zero-trust/zero-trust-overview), so you don't have to review the full list and make that decision yourself.\n@@ -56,6 +61,24 @@ Sample prompts:\n \n If you didn't ask the agent to prioritize the order of the suggestions and you ask for more details on the first suggestion, the agent tells you about the first item in the **Recent suggestions** list.\n \n+### Explain agent findings\n+\n+Ask the agent to to describe the details about the findings included in a policy suggestion. The agent will clarify the logic behind the suggestion and its impact on security and user experience.\n+\n+Sample prompts:\n+- *Who are the 12 users included in this suggestion?*\n+- *What are the 100 unprotected applications discovered by the agent?*\n+- *Why should I enable this policy?*\n+- *What happens if I accept a phased rollout suggestion?*\n+\n+### Summarize all agent findings\n+\n+If the agent identified several suggestions, it might be difficult to keep track of potential changes or impacted users, groups, and applications. You can ask the agent to summarize all findings across multiple suggestions to get a high-level overview. The agent provides an overview of the key suggestions, grouped by priority or category.\n+\n+Sample prompts:\n+- *Summarize my Conditional Access assessment.*\n+- *Provide an overview of all suggestions.*\n+\n ### Understand agent decisions\n \n In some cases, the agent might identify several policy suggestions that, at first glance, might appear similar to other policies. You can ask the agent to help you understand why one policy was selected for an update when multiple policies could apply. You can ask in the chat why the agent chose a specific policy for update.\n@@ -93,9 +116,14 @@ You can access the chat from the main Conditional Access Optimization Agent page\n \n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/conditional-access-agent-optimization-chat/agent-chat-policy-suggestions.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of a policy suggestion details page with the Chat with agent button highlighted.\" lightbox=\"media/conditional-access-agent-optimization-chat/agent-chat-policy-suggestions.png\":::\n \n-1. Enter a prompt in the chat window using natural language from the supported scenarios in the [What you can do with chat](#what-you-can-do-with-chat) section.\n+1. Enter a prompt in the chat window using natural language from the supported scenarios in the [What you can do with chat](#what-you-can-do-with-chat) section. The following quick-start prompts are provided to help you get started.\n+\n+    - **Summarize**: *What is my overall assessment of Conditional Access policies?*\n+    - **Analyze**: *What suggestions should I implement first to optimize my Zero Trust posture?*\n+    - **Troubleshoot**: *Tell me more about this suggestion.*\n+    - **Learn**: *What can you help me with?*\n \n-1. Review the response and apply the recommended changes. For more information, see the [Confirm changes in chat](#confirm-changes-in-chat) section.\n+1. Review the response and apply the recommended changes. For more information, see the [Confirm changes in chat](#confirm-changes-in-chat) section. Every chat response provides the option to copy the response and provide feedback on the response.\n \n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/conditional-access-agent-optimization-chat/agent-chat-confirm-cancel.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Conditional Access optimization agent chat with the options to confirm or cancel changes.\" lightbox=\"media/conditional-access-agent-optimization-chat/agent-chat-confirm-cancel.png\":::\n "
  },
